title: The Breeders’ Kim Deal Shares New Song “A Good Time Pushed”: Listen

html:
Featuring her Breeders bandmates Jim Macpherson and Kelley Deal, with engineering by the late Steve Albini

Kim Deal has shared a new song, “A Good Time Pushed,” from her debut solo album, Nobody Loves You More. The track features Deal’s Breeders bandmates Jim Macpherson and Kelley Deal, with engineering by the late Steve Albini. Check out the song’s visualizer, from Mark Satterthwaite, below, ahead of the LP release on November 23, via 4AD.

Deal, who left Pixies in 2013 and has since focused on her work with the Breeders, announced the solo album in August with an Alex Da Corte–directed video for “Crystal Breath.” Before that, she released “Coast.” Breeders’ last album was All Nerve, released in 2018.

Read Judy Berman’s Sunday Review of the Breeders’ Pod.

Jazz Monroe is a music and culture writer based in London. His work also appears in The Guardian, The Independent, and elsewhere.
